CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Increase in electron - donating strength of the counit leads to upshift in both HOMO and LUMO , while increase in electron - withdrawing strength of the counit leads to downshift in both HOMO and LUMO.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| counit |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) |

In this paragraph, the "Material Name" entities refer to:

1. counit: A unit that donates or withdraws electrons, affecting the energy levels of the HOMO and LUMO.
2. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital): The highest energy level in a molecule that still has electrons.
3. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital): The lowest energy level in a molecule that does not have electrons.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| counit |

In this paragraph, the "Material Name" entity refers to:

1. counit: A unit that donates or withdraws electrons, affecting the energy levels of the HOMO and LUMO.

The other entities, HOMO and LUMO, are not material names but rather energy levels in a molecule.

Paragraph: Increase in electron - donating strength of the counit leads to upshift in both HOMO and LUMO , while increase in electron - withdrawing strength of the counit leads to downshift in both HOMO and LUMO.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Increase in electron - donating strength |
| Upshift in both HOMO and LUMO |
| Increase in electron - withdrawing strength |
| Downshift in both HOMO and LUMO |

In this paragraph, the "Property Value" entities refer to the changes in the electron-donating strength and electron-withdrawing strength of the counit, as well as the resulting shifts in the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) energies.
